summary: This is a Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York Daily Activity Report for July 11, 2019. It details staffing shortages, inmate counts, and administrative leave for the day. The report is significant as it provides a snapshot of the prison's operations shortly before Jeffrey Epstein's death there in August 2019.

events.title: MCC New York Daily Operations
events.description: Daily activity report for the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, noting staff shortages, inmate counts by unit, and administrative leave usage.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The report documents a staff shortage at MCC New York on July 11, 2019, leading to vacated correctional officer assignments.
The total inmate population at the beginning of the morning watch shift on July 11, 2019, was 794.
The report indicates one inmate was on suicide watch with an inmate companion.
Administrative data shows various types of leave were utilized by staff, including sick leave and suspensions.
This routine administrative report provides context for the prison's operational state in the month prior to Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.
